comment: His tests are challenging, and everything you studied for won't help. He is a harsh grader, which makes it worse. Do not take him.

Dr. Stachura is a great professor. The online homework was hard, but the quizzes and exams were a breeze. The lectures are engaging and easy to follow. My only complaint is the group project, but my issue was more with the people in the group than with the project itself. Both of the projects were super easy.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: H

Idk where to start, Tests were absolutely atrocious, quizzes every week, even if you have an exam that week. SI sessions is just jeopardy, which is useless. Tells us to study one thing for the exam and puts the opposite on the test. Ever heard of a project in math class? It was 2 essays. (each is 10% of ur grade). Please just take someone else

There is almost a quiz every week but they aren't too bad at all with moderate studying. There is homework due every week but they are never very hard. There are two group projects which can help to boost your grade, but they were pretty annoying. The tests are not bad if you study your notes and quizzes. He boosts grades a little at the end too.

Very accessible outside of class and responds to emails quickly. Lot of material to cover but he has an SI and willing to answer any questions. Attendance isn't mandatory but heavily advised as he doesn't put the completed notes up and it's the best way to learn the material. Be careful of group project deadlines and read the rubric!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR, Test over one topic, quizzes over something else and he gives a project that has nothing to do with Diff Eq. Its a complete distraction and expects you to make a math based project in essay format.. 4 exams, 1 final, and quizzes every week. Even if you have a test the same week. No dropped exams either. get ready to fail
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Tests over one thing,quiz over another causes confusion. Projects detract from studies and pier review grades unfairly weighted. Projects related to uninteresting and unrelated majors. Online textbook, but instructs from board and lecture slides, confusing. Would be nice if he taught math and not back and forth confusing and unrelated material.

His lectures make sense on the spot but when you go do the hw they don't anymore. Tests are pretty hard and give you ptsd. The class struggled overall. This is calc 4 so the course is hard in general so take that into account. My only two cents is look at the sections online and start doing those practice tests.

If you're NOT a math major, do not take professor Stachura. All class lectures and examples are theoretical and he believes all students should be at his level of math. Heck, even if you're a math major, save yourself the headache and do not take this man, avoid.

Took him for ODE online this summer. He is the most amazing professor Ive had for differential equations. Grading was based off of hw, showing up to class, exams, and the final. If the class average was low for an exam, he provided the chance for test corrections. His handwriting is so-so but I didnt mind. He is very caring and understanding tho
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: To be fair, this was fall 2020 and everything was online. My experience was as such Young guy, into math but he's very keyed up Lectures were miserable. It was all chicken scratch on an ipad/ppt. The slides he posted just had problems he worked out in class but no actual notes or steps. I had to rent a hard copy of textbook to understand.

If you study the homework and attend the SI sessions his tests are not very hard. It is important that you show up to class as much as possible and take notes. If you skip a day or two of class, things will become very confusing. Overall, I'm glad to have taken his class.

Favorite professor yet, made me think about becoming a math major. Does a good job explaining the process and enjoyable to learn. You won't walk in and get a free A, but between class and homework (don't chegg all of it) you will learn the content. HW isn't too crazy but may need some assistance, also NOT a lot amount of HW

Limited resources. No online notes. Doesnt really explain things the first time. Lost week due to snow so he rushed the rest of the course. Hes a proofs professor so hes strict on showing work. Gives partial credit until the final exam. Our class averaged a 50-53% on every exam and a 39% on the final. Strongly suggest studying 10h per wk +Curves
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Active an engaging lecturer, but very focused on group work exercises. For me, this was a poor way to learn, so I was resentful of spending half of my class time working "in groups" (aka doing all the work on my own) on Calculus problems.

The only issue I had with this guy as what was that his email responses were either brief or wouldn't respond at all. Like other said no calculators but you don't need them I mean Common Sense should tell you that have no calculators are allowed the calculations aren't going to be hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Tests are 100% free response, can't use calculators, doesn't put the solutions to the worksheets to what we do in class online, no extra credit, no curve, quizzes every week, some of the problems on the tests are like a different language to what we do in class. Also, 1 problem on the test can be worth up to 25 points.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: if you have taken AP calculus you will have it somewhat easier time than the rest of the class..... GOOD LUCK!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I have taken calc before in high school, so I assumed that it would be easy. Not the case here; you are expected to handle problems the way he teaches. He quizzes EVERY week, and I think this makes it worse. You are constantly under stress in this class. He gives out group assignments that aren't graded, but does not post the solutions online.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY
